name: Octopus Art, The Lapis Lazuli Kraken, Kraken Decanter, Octopus Sculpture by Elstwhen.
description:
The Lapis Lazuli Kraken, Kraken Decanter, Octopus Sculpture by Elstwhen. 

Limited Edition Glassware & Sculpture.
This Kraken was sculpted onto its vintage decanter,
using a stone like material that is firmly attached to the glass. 
After the sculpting, the Kraken was hand-painted and gloss finished. 
This art work was made to last, using professional materials and 
specialized techniques (I do not use polymer clay).

About:
This Lapis Lazuli Kraken, is of the Sea Fire species.
Sea fires are unique among Kraken kind for several reasons.... 
Of course they are as venomous as the Basaltys, and as mean tempered as the Silkys,
but they also possess the ability to bio-lumines. Even as tiny plankton they glow and shimmer.

Sea fires are the most troublesome of all Kraken as they seem to have a fondness 
for "storm riding" as a mode of fast transport, that carries them far from their brood waters 
and, sometimes, beaching the young ones on some unlucky coastline.

Size: 23 oz capacity, 10 inches tall by 5 inches wide.
Weight: 2 lbs, 3 oz. 

Kraken Color: Lapis Lazuli.
The Eyes: are light sapphire Crystal. 
The Decanter: Subtlety fluted, stemmed, Crystal,


Each sculpture comes with a Certificate of Authenticity signed by the Artist.

*************************************************
Kraken Care:
Hand wash gently with warm soapy water 
Do not scrub painted surfaces, or allow to soak.
Rinse & pat away excess water, air dry.
Not for use with dish washing machines, 
or Microwave ovens. 
*************************************************

Kraken Lore: 

In a time when the gods still walked the earth, a child was born to Tethys and Poseidon. 
This was the Kraken - guardian of all the world's oceans and terror to all who traveled upon them.
Read more Kraken lore by Elstwhen at http://elstwhen.tumblr.com/

Like Elstwhen on Facebook for Sneak Peeks and updates.
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Elstwhen/188873717811093


Shipping: 
I take great care in packing my glassware to ensure safe transit.
If you intend to order more than one glassware, 
please contact me and I will see if your order can be packaged together to save on shipping

Domestic Shipping: 
Insurance and Delivery Confirmation included, USPS Priority Mail.

If your shipping destination is not listed, please contact me with your postal zip code and I will add it for you

name: The Blood Demon Kraken Decanter, Octopus Sculpture by Elstwhen.
description:
The Blood Demon Kraken Decanter, Octopus Sculpture by Elstwhen. 

Limited Edition Glassware & Sculpture. 
This Kraken was sculpted onto this glassware, using a stone like material that is firmly attached to the glass. After the sculpting, the Kraken is hand-painted and gloss finished. 
This art work was made to last, using professional materials and specialized techniques 
(I do not use polymer clay).

Flasks and Decanters are sold without any contents.
Any contents shown are for photographic purpose only

About:

This Blood Demon is a Seafire Kraken, 
Seafires are unique among their species for several reasons.... 
Of course they are as venomous as the Basaltys, and as mean tempered as the Silkys,
but they also possess the ability to bio-lumines. Even as tiny plankton they glow and shimmer.
This creeper of the deep changes color from vascular blue to purple abyss 
with the ambient light surrounding it.
Seafires are the most troublesome of all Kraken as they seem to have a fondness 
for "storm riding" as a mode of fast transport, that carries them far from their brood waters 
and, sometimes, beaching the young ones on some unlucky coastline.

Size: 16 oz capacity, 9 inches tall by 5 3/4 inches wide. 
Weight: 1 lb, 11 oz. 

Kraken Color: Black, Iridescent Purple.
The Eyes: are Crimson Crystal.
Barnacles: Black with Meridian Swarovski Crystal Rhinestones
The Decanter: Glass, Top Detail is un-painted, food and alcohol safe.

Each sculpture comes with a Certificate of Authenticity signed by the Artist.

*************************************************
Kraken Care:
Hand wash gently with warm soapy water 
Do not scrub painted surfaces, or allow to soak.
Rinse & pat away excess water, air dry.
Not recommended for dish washing machines, 
or Microwave ovens.

name: Octopus Sculpture. The Minoan Seafire Kraken, Amphora, Decanter by Elstwhen.
description:
The Minoan Seafire Kraken, Octopus Sculpture Amphora, Decanter by Elstwhen. 

Limited Edition Glassware & Sculpture.
These Kraken were sculpted onto their vintage glassware,
using a stone like material that is firmly attached to the glass. 
After the sculpting, the Kraken are hand-painted and gloss finished. 
This art work was made to last, using professional materials and 
specialized techniques (I do not use polymer clay).

About:
The Minoan Kraken,

This Minoan Seafire Kraken, is a real monster, he is the largest Kraken that has been captured to date.
Seafires are unique among their species for several reasons.... 
Of course they are as venomous as the Basaltys, and as mean tempered as the Silkys,
but they also possess the ability to bio-lumines. Even as tiny plankton they glow and shimmer.
This Mediterranean beauty changes color from turquoise blue to shimmering seas green 
with the ambient light surrounding it.

Although the Seafires are known for storm riding as a mode of fast transport, 
carrying most of them far from their brood waters. The Minoan Kraken has 
stayed close to his mother Charibdis at the straits of Messina. He was scooped up by a research vessel 
exploring the deepest parts of the Mediterranean Sea off the southern coast of Crete. 
He had apparently fallen asleep in one of the brine pools that was being sampled. 
Kraken seem to enjoy this toxic soup, it is thought that the bacteria growing in the brine have intoxicating effects.
This was fortunate for the crew of the submersible, had the Minoan woke on his way up, 
or he may have torn apart the bathysphere and eaten the crewmen. I wouldn't be surprised to find that he was responsible for the mysterious disappearance of the submarine DAKAR on its maiden voyage in 1968.

This Minoan Seafire Kraken is forever suspended in the state of euphoric inebriation that he was in when brought up from the depths, this lack of pressure makes even the mightiest of Krakens lethargic.

Size: 32 oz capacity, 13 inches tall by 5 inches wide. 
Weight: 2 lb, 15.35 oz. 

Kraken Color: Black, Iridescent Green, Iridescent Turquoise.
The Eyes are Crimson Crystal.
The Amphora: The glass is tinted slightly green. This color will not come off, it is not a coating.

Each sculpture comes with a Certificate of Authenticity signed by the Artist.


*************************************************
Kraken Care:
Hand wash gently with warm soapy water 
Do not scrub painted surfaces, or allow to soak.
Rinse & pat away excess water, air dry.
Not recommended for dish washing machines, 
or Microwave ovens. 
*************************************************

Kraken Lore: 

In a time when the gods still walked the earth, a child was born to Tethys and Poseidon. 
This was the Kraken - guardian of all the world's oceans and terror to all who traveled upon them.
Read more Kraken lore by Elstwhen at http://elstwhen.tumblr.com/

Like Elstwhen on Facebook for pre views and updates.
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Elstwhen/188873717811093

name: Octopus Art, Oceans Song, Dreams of Tonga. Kraken sculpture on hand blown glass Conch shell.
description:
Oceans Song, Dreams of Tonga. Kraken sculpture on hand blown glass Conch shell.
A collaboration of art by Elstwhen and Vandy 'Aelfgifu' Hall.


Limited Edition Glassware & Sculpture.

The Oceans Song, Dreams of Tonga, Kraken was sculpted Stevie Pagano, onto this stunning free-form, hand blown, glass Conch Shell made by Vandy 'Aelfgifu' Hall, in Vandy`s workshop near Portland, Oregon. Both sculptural elements of this artwork were made using profesional materials and techniques.

The Kraken is made of a stone like material (I do not use pollymer clay),
that is firmly attached to the glassware. After the sculpting, it is hand-painted 
and gloss finished.

The Shell is some of the mosy buttery lushious glass I have worked on 
and the sentious shape is the perfect home for a baby Kraken.

This tropical sculpture makes an interesting conversation piece,
place it to catch the light from a nearby window and bring some 
of the seas wonder into your home.


About:
Oceans Song, Dreams of Tonga, Kraken: 

This Tonganise Kraken is a member of the Silky Kraken species, 
and a very young one to be sure.
The Silkys are unique among Kraken kind for several reasons.... 
Of course they are as venomous as the Basaltys, but they are 
exceptionally mean tempered and sneaky, they are borne escape artists 
and have been known to hord objects they are fond of. 
This one has found a treasure he would not be parted from.

The Tonga Kraken was captured on Eua Island, here was washed up into the shallows, 
where the lack of pressure makes even the mightiest of Krakens lethargic.

Although it as yet unconfirmed, it is believed that the Silky Krakens thrive an area near the middle of the Pacific Ocean, 
At the crushing depths of up to 33,000 feet, one of the deepest parts of the sea floor known as the Tonga Trench. 
Upwellings from deep have been known to disloge some juvinal Kraken from there abyssal nursery and deposite them onto these secluded beaches.


Size: 4 inches tall by 10 1/2 inches wide. 
Weight: 1 lb 15 oz. 

Kraken Color: White 
The Eyes: are Aquamarine Crystal.

Glass Color: Clear and swirled Aquamarine. The color will not come off. It is the color of the glass not a coating.



Kraken Lore: 

In a time when the gods still walked the earth a child was born to Tethys and Poseidon. 
This was the Kraken - guardian of all the world's oceans and terror to all who traveled upon them.

The Kraken was once mated to his half-sister after Zeus' anger had changed her 
into a monster in the form of a whirlpool with a gaping maw of teeth. 
Her name was Kharybdis, a beautiful naiad and daughter of Gæa and Poseidon.

Kharybdis would be forever carrying the Kraken`s offspring within her. 
She releases her brood at the height of each full moon. 
Casting them forth onto all the world's oceans and giving rise to the legends and lore among early mariners.

These mysterious hatch lings inhabit the deep oceanic trenches and perpetually turbulent waters of the world. 
Thankfully, they are born without the ability to breed and take centuries to mature into smaller versions of their father. 
On the longest of years, Mother Kharbydis has daughters (who take after her).

The legends tell us that they are fearsome and appear with little warning out of the deep, 
voraciously devouring the most seaworthy vessels with ease. Occasionally, leaving a rare survivor to tell the tale. 
by Stevie Pagano.

© copyright Stevie Pagano / Elstwhen 2013
Elstwhen, 2013.
Photographs and Lore by Stevie Pagano.

About Elstwhen: http://www.etsy.com/shop/Elstwhen/about?ref=announce
